Dealing with rejection is a common challenge that MLM business owners often face. Here are some tips that may help:

1. Don't take it personally: Rejection doesn't mean that the person doesn't like or value you personally. It just means that they're not interested in your products or business opportunity right now. Try not to take it personally, and don't let it affect your confidence. 2. Keep a positive attitude: Cultivate a positive attitude and mindset to handle rejection when it comes your way. Instead of perceiving it as a failure, see it as an opportunity to refine your skills and develop new strategies. 3. Focus on the next person: Don't dwell on a rejection. Shift your attention to the next person, and try to find someone who might be interested. There are always more people to talk to, and even if someone says no, they might still know someone who could benefit from what you offer. 4. Use rejection as a learning opportunity: When you experience rejection, try to reflect on what you could have done differently. This can help you refine your approach and improve your strategies for the next time. 5. Stay determined and persistent: Persistence is key to success in MLM businesses. Keep in mind that it may take many rejections before you achieve success. Stay determined, focused, and motivated, and don't give up on achieving your goals.
